intro: Alyogyne cravenii, commonly known as the Craven's alyogyne, is a small evergreen shrub native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and other aromatic plants. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are usually covered in a fine, white powdery coating. It produces small, white or pale pink flowers clustered in dense, rounded inflorescences. Alyogyne cravenii is often found in sandy soils and is adapted to the dry, arid conditions of its native habitat.
